results.title: Hatari
results.creator_credit: Howard Hawks, Malabar Productions and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: Director Howard Hawks reteams with John Wayne, who heads a group of highly skilled professional game hunters in Africa. They don’t use bullets, rather capturing the ferocious big game with rope and cameras for zoos and circus attractions, an exciting business that pits man against beast. “Hatari” means “danger” in Swahili and the fine cast of this spectacular adventure film also includes Hardy Kruger, Red Buttons and Elsa Martinelli and Gerard Blain.

results.title: Feux follets
results.creator_credit: Jean-Claude Labrecque, Jacques Bobet and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Les Feux Follets (Will-‘o-the-Wisps) was founded as an amateur dance group in Montreal and developed into a professional group whose repertoire represents the folklore and the ethnic origins of the Canadian people. Two dances illustrate the group’s virtuosity - a Plains Indian Betrothal dance, and a more frenetic exhibition of the sixties “go-go” dancing. Choreographed by Michel Cartier; music Claude Poirier; sound by Ron Alexander, Roger Lamoureux, Bernie Bordeleau and photographed and edited by Jean-Claude Labrecque.

results.title: Autism: who cares (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Ivan Gaal, Horizontal Films and Victorian Autistic Children's Association
results.brief_description: Four centres for autistic children in Victoria show how they deal with this problem. Details how they are able to teach the children to eventually integrate into the community. Photographer: Leigh Tilson

results.title: Selling solidarity = Australian unionism in the '90's
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Best of Lateline”.
Australia has always had a strong union heritage. Peter Robson, (National President of the CPSU), and Peter Sams, (Secretary of the NSW Labour Council, discuss reasons for the rapidly declining membership and the ACTU’s multi-million dollar plan to recruit a new generation of workers.

results.title: Didjeridu: with Charlie McMahon
results.creator_credit: Jeni Kendell, Paul Tait and Gaia Films
results.brief_description: A journey with Charlie McMahon from the famed band “Gondwanaland” into the beautiful country of the Northern Territory. Accompanied by Aboriginal players and makers of the didjeridu, we see how the instruments are made and played by experts.

results.title: I accuse = J'accuse
results.brief_description: Considered to be one of the most important anti-war films ever made, Abel Gance’s 1939 film is a remake of his original 1919 silent film. With the prospect of World War 2 imminent, gabel reconstructed his original to challenge the world. Jean Diaz is a research scientist who dedicates his life to ending war. When he discovers that his work is being exploited by the military, he summons up the ghosts of the war dead to make the world come to its senses.

results.title: A Story of women = Une Affaire de femmes
results.creator_credit: Claude Chabrol, Marin Karmitz and MK2 Productions
results.brief_description:
‘Une Affaire de Femmes’ has been hailed as one of Chabrol’s finest films. Based on the true story of Marie-Louise Giraud, a wartime mother and abortionist. Since the age of fourteen, Marie has been married to Paul, and has been a devoted and dedicated wife. When Paul returns from the war, he finds that life has changed. Marie-Louise has kept the home and family together and has plenty of money from her illegal business. She decides she no longer needs or wants Paul. The film exposes hypocrisy in its political and personal manifestations. Isabelle Huppert and Francois Cluzet star in this film which won an award for Huppert at the Venice Film festival and which was voted best film at the Melbourne International Film Festival in 1989.
Cast also includes: Marie Trintignant, Nils Tavernier

results.title: Eyes: their structure and care
results.brief_description: A farsighted young boy visits an optometrist and learns about the importance of protecting his eyes. The optometrist reviews the structure of the eyes, explains how the optical system functions, and discusses the cause of myopia, hyperopia, and astigmatism. Describes the work of an optometrist, and ophthalmologist, and an optician.

results.title: Big lies of the 20th Century
results.creator_credit: Michael Jones, Tomasz Malinowski, Channel Four and Panoptic Productions
results.brief_description: An examination of some of this Century’s significant acts of censorship. The emphasis of the program is how film has been manipulated to support political propaganda including Nazi Germany, the Vietnamese Conflict, during Stalin’s reign in the Soviet Union and the anti-communist trials in the United States. This is an invaluable program for showing how history and the media can conspire to make the process of seeking the truth more difficult.

results.title: Telephone technique
results.creator_credit: Wesley Greene, Crawley Films and International Film Bureau
results.brief_description: Part of a series on sales training, this episode deals with telephone training for retail sales clerks. It emphasizes good telephone manners, wide knowledge of stock, importance of correct customer name and address and the necessity for an intelligent descriptive vocabulary when speaking of merchandise over the telephone.
